snippet: The city’s Board of Elections still uses a counting system by hand that is prone to embarrassing errors on election night.
abstract: Editorial questions why New York City's Board of Elections still uses a counting system by hand that is prone to embarrassing errors on election night, as the recount for the Democratic primary for Rep Charles Rangel's seat has illustrated; calls for the Board of Elections to do away with hand-counting and let the voting machines do their job.
lead_paragraph: The city’s Board of Elections still uses a counting system by hand that is prone to embarrassing errors on election night.
